remarks: A theorem is a pre-statement, whose reduct is also the reduct of a provable pre-statement.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jul-2016.)
statement:
mthmval.r $e |- R = ( mStRed ` T ) $.
mthmval.j $e |- J = ( mPPSt ` T ) $.
mthmval.u $e |- U = ( mThm ` T ) $.
elmthm $p |- ( X e. U <-> E. x e. J ( R ` x ) = ( R ` X ) ) $.
$d J x $.
$d R x $.
$d T x $.
$d X x $.
